intro: Hieracium inuloides subsp. strictiforme, commonly known as the stiffform hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and dense, hairy leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its subspecies status reflects distinct morphological traits that set it apart from other members of the Hieracium genus.
